item.title: Euro 2020: Queen and Boris Johnson wish England well as final looms
item.description: The monarch praises the team's "spirit, commitment and pride" ahead of their match against Italy.

item.title: Fans can inspire us against Italy, says Southgate
item.description: England boss Gareth Southgate urges fans to roar his side to victory when the Three Lions face Italy in the Euro 2020 final at Wembley on Sunday.

item.title: Covid: NHS backlog in England could reach 13 million, says Sajid Javid
item.description: Sajid Javid says waiting list projections "shocked me the most" in his first days as health secretary.

item.title: Bernard Mongan: Failings by Army over soldier's death, report says
item.description: The body of L/Cpl Bernard Mongan was discovered in his barracks three weeks after he went missing.

item.title: Covid-19: NHS backlog warning and face masks still needed in Wales
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday.

item.title: Foreign aid: Gates and others to partially cover UK aid cuts
item.description: The group says the funding will help save "critical projects" and ensure progress is not "wasted".

item.title: Covid: Woman aged 90 died with double variant infection
item.description: Simultaneous infections are rare but can happen, particularly in people yet to be vaccinated, warn experts.

item.title: Sir Richard Branson: Space flight will be 'extraordinary'
item.description: The UK businessman is about to realise a lifetime's ambition by flying to the edge of space.

item.title: Covid: Face masks to stay in Wales but no decision on shops
item.description: Coverings will be needed on public transport and in health settings as law in shops is "discussed".

item.title: Dustin Poirier beats Conor McGregor after Irishman breaks leg in the first round at UFC 264
item.description: Dustin Poirier beats Conor McGregor in the first round of their trilogy fight at UFC 264 in Las Vegas.

item.title: Portugal orders house arrest for Benfica football club president
item.description: Luís Filipe Vieira is being investigated in Portugal for suspected tax fraud and money laundering.

item.title: Offa's Dyke: Monument damaged by 'centuries of benign neglect'
item.description: The Offa's Dyke earthwork has "a lot of catching up to do" with Hadrian's Wall and Stonehenge.

item.title: The Papers: 'We Kane be heroes' and 'jab gap to be cut'
item.description: Sunday's papers report a "heartfelt message" from the Queen ahead of England's Euro final against Italy.

item.title: Euro 2020: The pride of England stars' hometowns
item.description: We meet those in the England stars' hometowns who hope the boys can bring football home - literally.

item.title: ICYMI: A big cat 3D billboard and a tiny celebrity cow
item.description: Watch our round-up of the week's more paw-sitive stories that you miaow have missed.

item.title: Thousands of fish dropped from plane to restock Utah lakes
item.description: Wildlife authorities in Utah do this to restock lakes that aren't accessible to other forms of transport.

item.title: Euro 2020: Ex-SAS Atlantic rower relying on text updates for final
item.description: Ex-SAS soldier Ian Rivers has no way of seeing or hearing Sunday's England v Italy match.

item.title: Ros Atkins on… England’s Covid gamble
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at the UK government’s plan to lift Covid restrictions in England.

item.title: The schoolkids who said they saw 'aliens'
item.description: In 1994, 60 children at a Zimbabwe school said they'd seen a "UFO" - a BBC crew was first on the scene.

item.title: Mystery North Norfolk treasure 'could be sword-related'
item.description: Experts say they don't know what the early Anglo-Saxon object is, but it could be part of a sword.

item.title: 'Indians don't talk about sex - so I help them'
item.description: An Indian sex coach says parents turn to her for advice as sex education is not available in schools.

item.title: The foreigners in China’s disinformation drive
item.description: Foreigners are increasingly appearing on YouTube promoting China's narrative on issues like Xinjiang.

item.title: How did my phone number end up for sale on a US database?
item.description: A journey of discovery into the somewhat opaque, if lucrative, world of contact selling

item.title: From living in a tent to financial independence
item.description: Schemes helping homeless people lacking IDs to get bank accounts are transforming hundreds of lives.

item.title: Why Canada is reforming indigenous foster care
item.description: The residential school legacy has been linked to the overrepresentation of indigenous children in care.

item.title: Are lots of people deleting the NHS Covid app?
item.description: Are people using the government's Covid app or are they deleting it?

item.title: Fire lookouts: The US Forest Service lookouts watching for fires
item.description: In remote towers, US Forest Service lookouts act as an early warning system for forest fires.

item.title: Messi wins first major trophy with Argentina as Brazil beaten in Copa America final
item.description: Lionel Messi ends his wait for a first major international title as Argentina beat Brazil in the Copa America final.

item.title: South Africa captain Kolisi tests positive for Covid-19 two weeks before Lions series
item.description: South Africa captain Siya Kolisi tests positive for coronavirus as his side build up to the series against the British and Irish Lions.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Novak Djokovic and Matteo Berrettini set for men's final
item.description: Novak Djokovic aims to win a sixth Wimbledon - and record-equalling 20th Grand Slam men's title - when he plays Italy's Matteo Berrettini on Sunday.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Ashleigh Barty beats Karolina Pliskova to win women's title
item.description: Ashleigh Barty wins her maiden Wimbledon title beating Karolina Pliskova to become the first Australian women's champion for 41 years.

item.title: Euro 2020: Gareth Southgate says he wants England to 'bring the trophy home'
item.description: England manager Gareth Southgate says he wants his England side to "bring the trophy home" when they face Italy in the Euro 2020 final at Wembley on Sunday.

item.title: England v Pakistan ODI: Phil Salt shines as England secure ODI series win over Pakistan
item.description: Watch some of the best shots as Phil Salt scores 60 helping England beat Pakistan by 52 runs in the second one-day international at Lord's.

item.title: England v Italy: 'Inspirational England help heal national sporting psyche before historic final'
item.description: An England team that became sadly symbolic with failure has now helped inspire and heal a national sporting psyche. How did they reach this point?

item.title: Euro 2020: Kalvin Phillips' rise from Wortley to Wembley
item.description: The 25-year-old's Euro 2020 heroics have been cheered on by friends and family back in Leeds.

item.title: Meet the Italians standing between England and glory
item.description: Everything you need to know about the Italians who stand in the way of England and the European Championship trophy

item.title: Football-mad Italians gear up for big night
item.description: Italy's success in the Euro competition has lifted spirits after the pandemic, Mark Lowen reports.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: How to watch and follow Italy v England on the BBC
item.description: England are one win away from a first major men's tournament triumph since 1966 - and you can watch and follow all the action from Sunday's Euro 2020 final with Italy on the BBC.

item.title: 'Euro 96 was tears of sadness, Euro 2020 tears of pure joy'
item.description: From the 1966 World Cup triumph to the last 55 years of hurt, these are your memories of following the Three Lions.

item.title: Euro 2020: Jewels remain... Get Grealish... England fan-speak explained
item.description: Why is football coming home? Who was Jules Rimet? And what's a penalty shootout? Read on...

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch the final?
item.description: Wembley will host 60,000 fans at the final, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

item.title: I'm 17 - when will I be jabbed? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about England's roadmap out of lockdown, and other Covid-related issues.

item.title: Vaccine passports: How can I prove I've had both my Covid jabs?
item.description: Fully-vaccinated people in England will be able to avoid self-isolation after travel or contact with a positive case.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.
